title: Googleโs new checkout protocol lets you buy products without leaving your search results
summary: Googleโs new Universal Commerce Protocol lets AI find, compare, and buy items in one flow.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Googleโs new universal checkout protocol aims to complete the purchase for you directly within a Gemini chat or AI search interface. Google built the Universal Commerce Protocol with input from major players like Shopify, Walmart, Target, Etsy, and Wayfair, with more than 20 partners already signed on. The new โBusiness Agentsโ also let brands answer shopper questions in conversational results using their own product knowledge. Imagine asking your phone for new running shoes, and instead of just getting links, an AI finds and buys them for you, so you donโt have to switch between tabs. That future is now much closer. Google has unveiled a new open-standard framework that aims to make autonomous, AI-led shopping a real part of how we buy things online. At the center of this change is a protocol called Universal Commerce Protocol (UCP). It serves as a common language, enabling AI agents to connect with retailers, payment systems, and shopping platforms without requiring custom connections.

title: Susan Schuh: Supporting the Humans in Human Spaceflight
summary: Susan Schuh has dedicated her career to helping humans adapt to life beyond Earth. As the Flight Crew Integration Operational Habitability (OpsHab) team lead in NASAโs Human Health and Performance Directorate at Johnson Space Center in Houston, Schuh leads efforts to understand what it is really liโฆ
body: Susan Schuh has dedicated her career to helping humans adapt to life beyond Earth.   As the Flight Crew Integration Operational Habitability (OpsHab) team lead in NASAโs Human Health and Performance Directorate at Johnson Space Center in Houston, Schuh leads efforts to understand what it is really like to live and work in space. She turns that information into progress by documenting astronautsโ feedback to improve current and future spaceflight missions.  Official portrait of Susan Schuh. NASA/Josh Valcarcel Her work not only supports crews aboard the International Space Station, but also provides critical information for NASA’s preparations to explore more of the lunar surface than ever before through Artemis missions.   Her team supports astronaut inflight and postflight debriefs, capturing and analyzing feedback to help NASA apply lessons learned. They also manage one of NASAโs most valuable habitability tools, the Crew Comments Database. With more than 115,000 entries spanning 25 years of International Space Station missions, it is the only comprehensive and searchable record of crew feedback in existence. body: I havenโt typed a single word in this story โ all of it came to life through my voice. title: Shaken, Not Stirred: NASAโs StarBurst Aces Extreme Temperature Tests
summary: Heated, cooled, shaken, and settled โ NASAโs StarBurst instrument is several steps closer to being ready for launch. The small satellite is now awaiting instrument calibration following a successful integration in Canada and rigorous testing by engineers at the agencyโs Marshall Space Flight Centerโฆ
body: NASAโs StarBurst instrument outside a thermal vacuum chamber at NASAโs Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama. NASA/Daniel Kocevski Heated, cooled, shaken, and settled โ NASA’s StarBurst instrument is several steps closer to being ready for launch. The small satellite is now awaiting instrument calibration following a successful integration in Canada and rigorous testing by engineers at the agencyโs Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama. StarBurst is designed to detect the initial emission of short gamma-ray bursts, some of the most powerful explosions in the universe and a key indicator of neutron star mergers. This would provide valuable insight into such events, which are also detected through gravitational waves by observatories on Earth. These events are where most of the heavy metals in the universe, such as gold and platinum, are formed. To date, only one such event has been observed simultaneously in gravitational waves and gamma-rays; StarBurst is expected to find up to 10 per year. StarBurst arrived at NASA Marshall in March 2025. During its time at the center, the instrument underwent thermal testing in a vacuum chamber and flight vibratโฆ

From left, Johns Hopkins APL engineers Tyler Radomsky and Felipe Ruiz install a rotor on the Dragonfly test model at the Transonic Dynamics Tunnel at NASAโs Langley Research Center in Virginia. body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google is removing the paywall from its top-tier Gmail AI tools, previously locked behind subscriptions like Google AI Plus and Ultra. Features such as Help Me Write, Suggested Replies, and AI Overviews are now rolling out to everyone for free. If you thought the best Gmail tricks were only for paying subscribers, youโre not alone. For quite some time, Gmailโs most helpful new AI features have only been available to premium users. Thatโs changing now. Google is removing the paywall and giving three of its most useful tools to every Gmail user for free. Before this change, getting all the AI features in Gmail meant subscribing to high-tier plans like Google AI Plus, Google AI Ultra, Google AI Pro, or other Premium tiers. Now, that barrier is gone. Regular Gmail users will soon get a big upgrade in how they manage daily emails without spending a dime.

title: Gmail now answers your email questions like Google Search โ but youโll have to pay for it
summary: You can now ask questions in natural language, and Gmail will give you a summarized answer from your emails.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Gmail users can now use natural language questions to find specific information buried in their emails, presented to them as an AI Overview. The new Proofread feature in Gmail enables users to refine their grammar, tone, conciseness, and style using AI. Both features are powered by Gemini and are available exclusively to paid Google AI Pro and Ultra subscribers in English, with a web-first rollout in the US. Most of us use Gmail practically every day, and any improvements Google can make to make emails a little easier to handle would be appreciated by billions of people worldwide (three billion, to be precise). The company announced that some of Gmailโs most helpful new AI features are now being made available to all users for free . Thereโs still a reason to pay for Gmail, though, as Google is now introducing new features for Google AI Pro and Ultra subscribers. Donโt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Gmail will soon help you make sense of your messy inbox, Inbox-style
summary: It's like getting a lowdown from an assistant who reads your emails for you.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Google has announced a new AI Inbox feature that will organize important emails from your Gmail inbox into handy to-do lists. AI Inbox will prioritize emails from VIPs, such as those you email frequently or people in your Contacts. In addition to heads-up for important events, the feature will also offer summaries based on different conversations about a related topic. For more than a decade, Gmail has automatically sorted your emails in different categories, using labels such as Primary, Social, Promotions, etc. The method has been effective, but given the bloated influx of emails, both spammy and useful, Google has determined it needs to step up. This is why it is piloting a new mechanism that not only sorts and prioritizes your important emails but also provides a summary of whatโs important, so you stay on top. And as youโd expect, it is powered by Gemini . Google is calling this new Gmail experience โAI Inbox,โ perhaps because it is built on the same productivity-focused ethos as the now-entombed Google Inbox . It says AI Inbox is identical to being briefed by a personal assistant for your most important commitments and gettinโฆ

title: 10 of the coolest tech products we saw at CES 2026
summary: Phones, robot vacuum cleaners, AI-powered headphones, and more.
body: Weโve kicked off the year with a visit to CES 2026 , where companies from all over the world gathered to showcase their latest tech products. From new phones and TVs to robots and handheld gaming consoles, thereโs a lot to see. However, some of these products grabbed more attention than others. Here are the 10 coolest ones we saw at the show in Las Vegas.

title: Samsungโs Ballie robot rolls to a halt
summary: Samsung has shelved its Ballie robot indefinitely and turned it into an internal research project instead.
body: Credit: Samsung TL;DR Samsung has shelved Ballie, killing plans for a consumer launch that was once teased for summer 2025. Ballie has shifted from a planned retail product to an internal โactive innovation platform,โ meaning itโs now for Samsungโs labs. Samsungโs cute, rolling robot assistant, once promised for homes by summer 2025 , has now been shelved. This shift marks a sudden turn from the optimism Samsung showed when Ballie was first introduced in 2020. The small, round robot was meant to be a mobile smart home assistant that could follow you, control devices, and project images onto walls. Now, Samsung is effectively putting an end to hopes for a commercial launch.

title: I spent 20 minutes with Razerโs AI anime girlfriend, and now I need a shower
summary: This is Razer Project Ava, and it sure is ... something.
body: Itโs not a proper CES if I havenโt seen at least one gadget thatโs left me scratching my head and reconsidering my life choices. For CES 2026, I experienced that during my demo session of Razerโs Project Ava. Project Ava was first teased at last yearโs CES, and at the time, it was being marketed as a semi-serious AI gaming assistant. The idea was that Ava would monitor your gaming performance to provide real-time feedback and coaching, helping you improve across virtually any title.

title: How Android 16 quietly became Googleโs best update in years
summary: It started as the most boring update, but Android 16 has grown into a very impressive, feature-filled version.
body: When Android 16 landed on Pixels early last summer, it didnโt make much of a splash. To say that many of us were disappointed by what we saw โ or what we didnโt see, to be fair โ would be an understatement. Android 16 felt like Android 15.1, a minor upgrade with some interesting new features, but nothing more. A lot of what was promised with Android 16 didnโt come with that first release. Instead, it took a few months and a couple of quarterly updates, but itโs obvious to me now that Android 16 is the best Android version weโve had in many years.

title: CES 2026: Segway Navimowโs latest robotic lawn mowers are โdrop and mowโ ready
summary: Segway Navimow unveiled its latest robot lawn mowers, featuring significant performance and feature upgrades.
body: Credit: Navimow Beautiful, picture-perfect lawns and backyards look fantastic, but anyone who has had to drag around a heavy lawn mower knows how difficult and time-consuming they are to maintain. And even if you went the robot lawn mower route before, installing base stations and perimeter wires is another complicated and tedious chore. Segway Navimow addresses both of these concerns and more with their latest robot lawn mowers. Navimow showed off five new lineups at CES 2026 โ four ideal for residential use, while a new series marks the brandโs first foray into commercial lawn mowing. The i2, H2, X4, and Terranox series address very different yard types, from simple suburban lawns to complex, obstacle-dense landscapes and extreme terrain. And most importantly, they make lawn maintenance a breeze.

title: I turned my Pixel 10 Pro into a 2026 BlackBerry and LG Wing โ seriously
summary: Keyboard cases aren't my thing, but the Clicks Power Keyboard has my attention.
body: For the last couple of years, Clicks has been one of the more interesting brands in the mobile accessory space. After creating keyboard cases for various iPhone and Android phone models, the company came to CES 2026 to showcase something a little different: a keyboard you can attach to any smartphone, without the commitment of a full-on case. Itโs called the Clicks Power Keyboard, and it snaps onto the back of your phone via MagSafe/Qi2 magnets โ instantly turning your phone into a modern-day BlackBerry. Compared to Clicksโ keyboard cases , the Power Keyboard has a couple of key benefits: 1) You can attach and remove the Clicks Power Keyboard much more easily than a case, and 2) it allows the keyboard to be attach to any phone that has magnets, whether built into it or via a compatible case.

title: RayNeo Air 4 Pro brings worldโs first HDR10 AR display to your face
summary: These 76g glasses feature Bang & Olufsen audio and a custom Vision 4000 chip for an immersive 201-inch cinema experience.
body: RayNeo Air 4 Pro: Worldโs First HDR10-enabled AR Glasses TL;DR RayNeo has launched the Air 4 Pro globally at CES 2026, featuring the worldโs first HDR10 AR displays and Bang & Olufsen-tuned audio. The Air 4 Pro uses FHD micro-OLED displays to create a virtual 201-inch screen experience. These lightweight glasses are expected to go on sale on January 25 for $299. RayNeo has been making AR glasses for a while now, and the company just launched the RayNeo Air 4 Pro at CES 2026 . This marks the global debut of their latest AR glasses, which were launched in China last year. With the Air 4 Pro, RayNeo aims to deliver a cinema-like experience in a lightweight wearable form factor. It claims that these are the worldโs first HDR10 AR displays, offering brighter highlights, deeper shadows, and enhanced color and contrast within the AR experience. A Pixelworks-customized Vision 4000 chip offers real-time video enhancements, such as upscaling SDR content to HDR and converting 2D videos into 3D.

title: Bad with directions? Hereโs how Google Maps on Android XR could help you never get lost again
summary: Or help you course-correct when you end up getting lost anyway.
body: TL;DR Google might have begun working on navigation support for Android XR using Google Maps. Previously, Google has previewed how Maps and Gemini could work together to help you navigate, especially while walking. In addition to step-by-step navigation, your Android XR glasses could use feed from their cameras to help you when youโre feeling lost. Google will also give users the option to turn off navigation or alerts if they donโt want to use it. Android XR is Googleโs next big ambitious project that it envisages to power dozens of different styles of AR glasses and XR headsets over the next few years. Since the platform is closely related to the mobile version of Android, weโd also see a significant chunk of apps cross-functioning across both platforms. Maps is one of them, and Google has already demonstrated how you can use the app to find places of interest or for an immersive aerial or street view. Now, weโre seeing hints about how Android XR could enhance navigation in Google Maps, especially when youโre walking down the street. title: Samsung concludes Galaxy Ring investigation after swelling sent user to hospital
summary: Samsung says cracked molding, not battery, was to blame for the incident.
body: Credit: X/@ZONEofTECH TL;DR Samsung has completed its investigation into an incident that sent tech creator Daniel (@ZONEofTECH) to the hospital last year. The company states that the swelling in Danielโs Galaxy Ring was caused by a crack in its internal molding, not the battery. Samsung and an independent agency both reached the same conclusion. Samsung has officially concluded its investigation into a Galaxy Ring incident that sent a tech creator to the hospital in October last year. The company has reportedly determined that the issue was caused by a crack in the Galaxy Ringโs internal molding, confirming that the device doesnโt pose any wider battery safety risks.

title: Your Android-powered car will get faster updates thanks to Qualcomm
summary: Does your car have Android Automotive? There might be good news for you.
body: Credit: Google TL;DR Qualcomm has announced a partnership with Google for a โunified reference platformโ for Android Automotive OS, starting with Android 17. This means cars with Android Automotive and Snapdragon chips should get quicker access to new Google features. The chipmaker also announced that Project Treble is coming to cars with Snapdragon chips, speeding up system updates. Cars with Android Automotive OS offer a standalone Android experience without having to pair with an Android device. Now, Google and Qualcomm have announced some welcome developments in this space. Donโt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: The first Android Canary release of 2026 is here!
summary: The first Android Canary release of 2026 is here, and there are a couple of changes worth knowing.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google has released the January 2026 Android Canary build. Weโve found evidence that this software could bring Quick Share/AirDrop integration to Pixel 9 phones. We also spotted a few other visual changes compared to previous releases. Google regularly offers Android Canary builds, allowing users to try new features and changes before theyโre broadly released. Google launched the December 2025 Android Canary build a month ago, and itโs wasting no time in launching its first build of 2026. The company just released the January 2026 Android Canary build, dubbed Android Canary 2601. This build has the version number ZP11.251212.007.

title: Jealous of Pixel 10โs AirDrop trick? Pixel 9 is getting it too with latest Android Canary build
summary: The Pixel 9 series is next in line to support AirDrop-style sharing between Android and iPhone.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google has added AirDrop-related Quick Share system files to the Pixel 9 series firmware with the latest Android Canary build. Pixel 9a and Pixel 8 series devices donโt yet have these files, suggesting support isnโt reaching older Pixels yet. When Google announced Quick Share interoperability with Appleโs AirDrop late last year, the feature was introduced as a Pixel 10 exclusive. But new evidence suggests that exclusivity may not last very long. Weโve found signs that AirDrop-style sharing between Android and iPhone is now being prepared for older Pixel phones, starting with the Pixel 9 series.

title: 'Whoever signed off England's tour has to go' - Agnew column
summary: England's 4-1 Ashes defeat is the most disappointing I have covered and whoever signed off on the tourists' preparation has to go, writes Jonathan Agnew.

title: Google is quietly making the Pixel Launcher faster with a new shortcut
summary: You can now open apps more quickly with a shortcut instead of tapping the app icon.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google is pushing out a Pixel Launcher change that lets you open apps by pressing Enter after partially typing their name. The keyboard button switches from Google Search to an arrow/Enter shortcut when an app name is detected. After a limited test, the feature now appears to be rolling out to more Pixel users via a server-side rollout. Google appears to be rolling out a small but meaningful upgrade to the Pixel Launcher that makes opening apps faster than before. After previously testing the feature with a limited group of users, reports now suggest the change is reaching a wider audience.

title: Samsung is borrowing a neat Pixel lock screen trick for One UI 8.5
summary: Galaxy users can now add AI-generated weather effects to their lock screen wallpaper.
body: TL;DR One UI 8.5 includes new, Pixel-like weather effects for the lock screen. Youโll be able to add AI-generated weather effects to your lock screen wallpaper based on local weather conditions. Effects like rain or snowfall realistically move behind visible objects or people, rather than simply sitting on top of the wallpaper image. Smartphone brands have been paying extra attention to the lock screen lately, treating it as more than just a place to check notifications or check the time. From richer widgets to personalized wallpapers, the smartphone lock screen is becoming more personal, useful, and visually engaging. Samsungโs upcoming One UI 8.5 update looks set to continue that trend with a new weather-driven feature that adds a bit of magic to your wallpaper, and closely mirrors a similar idea Google already offers on Pixel phones. Donโt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: CES 2026: Narwalโs latest flagship vacuum robot headlines its next-generation smart cleaning product lineup
summary: At CES 2026, Narwal showcases it's latest flagship robot vacuum, new cordless handheld vacuums, and a mattress vacuum.
body: Narwal is a staple at tech shows like CES and IFA, and the popular smart home cleaning brand is kicking off 2026 with its latest flagship robot vacuum, the Narwal Flow 2 . Featuring a new design, significantly upgraded AI-powered features, an improved mopping system, and more power than ever before, the Narwal Flow 2 sets the standard in automated home cleaning. And thatโs not all! Along with the flagship robot, Narwal is expanding into other categories, including cordless and mattress vacuums. Hereโs everything you need to know. Narwal Flow 2: The 2026 flagship robot vacuum with the most powerful AI system

title: ChatGPT Health will help you get prepared for that doctorโs appointment
summary: ChatGPT's new health feature will help you analyze your wellness data.
body: Credit: OpenAI TL;DR OpenAI is making a push into health by introducing a new feature to its AI chatbot, called ChatGPT Health. This feature will allow users to analyze medical results, prepare for doctor appointments, and get diet and workout advice. ChatGPT Health can connect with electronic medical records and wellness apps. People use ChatGPT for a variety of purposes that can range anywhere from learning how to cook a new recipe to writing code. One of the more popular use cases for the chatbot is answering questions about health and wellness. Now OpenAI is making a greater push into the health space with the rollout of a new ChatGPT feature. Donโt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Survey shows most of you donโt like Remix in Google Messages
summary: About half of survey respondents wish they could disable the feature altogether.
body: Google Messages rolled out a Nano Banana-powered Remix feature late last year, letting users make AI edits to images sent and received right inside app. The implementation was heavy-handed, with a prominent Remix button displayed whenever you view an image in Messages full-size. Last month, we asked how you all felt about it โ and overwhelmingly, you told us youโre not into it. In a poll conducted by Android Authority , more than 1,000 readers have cast votes voicing their opinions on the Remix feature. A whopping 47% of respondents said they donโt like Remix, and that they wished the feature could be disabled.

title: Facer introduces Face Chime and other new features, expansion to RTOS watches
summary: Face Chime, new integrations, and new platforms โ a big year for Facer.
body: TL;DR Smartwatch face platform Facer made a few announcements at CES today. Facer will soon be available on some RTOS-based wearables. A new Face Chime feature allows watch face makers to add custom hourly chimes to their faces. Smartwatch face platform Facer announced a handful of notable updates at CES today. The popular custom watch face creator and marketplace is expanding to more smartwatch platforms, and Facer faces are getting new capabilities, including a handy hourly chime option. Facer is expanding to RTOS watches soon. Facer will be pre-installed on Reebokโs upcoming Kinetic smartwatch (seen in images here), which will run on VitalOS with MicroEJ VEE Wear. The companyโs also partnering with free and open-source graphics library LVGL, an integration thatโll see Facer watch faces available on RTOS-based watches from a number of brands, including Xiaomi.

title: CES 2026 just saw a game-changing 3D printer with multi-material and color abilities
summary: This 3D printer can handle multiple colors and materials, is whisper quiet, and is wildly efficient.
body: Credit: AtomForm TL;DR AtomForm has unveiled its latest 3D printer, the Palette 300. This 3D printer features 12 nozzles, allowing it to combine up to 36 colors and 12 materials in a single print. It also cuts waste by up to 90%, helping to reduce swap times. The Palette 300 will become available in early Q2 2026, with pre-orders starting in early Q1 2026. As expected, CES 2026 has been full of unique and interesting product announcements, ranging from a fuzzy emotional support buddy to the worldโs first wireless 7.1.4 Dolby Atmos system . One announcement that shouldnโt be overlooked involves a 3D printer that offers something you wonโt find on other 3D printers. Donโt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Mammotionโs new lineup wants to save you from having to rescue your outdoor robots
summary: Mammotion brings real autonomy to your yard with LUBA 3 and SPINO S1 Pro.
body: Credit: Mammotion TL;DR Mammotion showed off two flagship robots at CES 2026 that aim to remove manual lawn mowing and pool cleaning almost entirely. The LUBA 3 mower combines all-wheel drive with upgraded Tri-Fusion Navigation, including 360ยฐ LiDAR, dual-camera AI vision, and NetRTK for ยฑ1 cm accuracy. The SPINO S1 Pro pool cleaner features AutoShoreCharge, a robotic arm system that automatically lifts the unit out of the water and docks it for charging. Outdoor maintenance can be tough. Wrestling with a mower on a steep hill or pulling a heavy pool cleaner from the water makes the dream of a perfect yard feel like hard work. Mammotion wants to change that, and its CES 2026 showcase shows itโs almost there. The company is doubling down on its โtrue hands-freeโ philosophy, introducing two new flagship robots: the LUBA 3 lawn mower and the SPINO S1 Pro pool cleaner.

title: US judge vacates restraining order over Samsung โspying onโ smart TV users (Update)
summary: A hearing is scheduled for January 9.
body: TL;DR Samsung is one of five TV manufacturers accused of illegally collecting automated content recognition (ACR) data from TVs in the state of Texas. A temporary restraining order barred Samsung from collecting ACR data within the state, but the order has been vacated. A hearing to potentially impose a temporary injunction against Samsung is scheduled for January 9. Update, January 8, 2026 (10:57 AM ET): A Samsung representative has reached out to let us know that the temporary restraining order granted on Monday, January 5 was vacated on Tuesday, January 6. That means the order was not in effect when this article was initially published. We regret the error. A hearing is still scheduled for January 9. The original article appears below, unedited.

title: Tired of losing earbuds? OnePlus could introduce a new feature to help
summary: OnePlus may have come up with a cure for your fear of losing an earbud.
body: Credit: Lil Katz / Android Authority TL;DR OnePlus and OPPO could introduce a new feature to their earbuds that automatically detects when an earbud drops out of your ear. If you lose an earbud, your earbuds will play a sound and an alert will be sent to your phone that will help you find the fallen earbud. You may not receive an alert if the โNotificationsโ permission is turned off or the app is terminated. Have you ever lost an earbud because it unexpectedly fell out of your ear? OnePlus and OPPO appear to be working on a new feature that could help save you from suffering such a fate again. title: T-Mobile just announced its first fee increase of the year: Hereโs what is changing
summary: It might not be a massive increase, but it's the second of its kind in less than a full year's time.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR T-Mobile is raising its Regulatory Programs & Telco Recovery Fee by $0.50 per line starting January 21. Combined with the $.50 hike in April of 2025, fees are up about $1 in less than a year. The vague fee structure continues to draw criticism, though grandfathered plans with taxes and fees included are unaffected. Earlier today, T-Mobile unveiled its new Better Value Plan, promising a better experience for new and existing customers who switch to it. Like every plan offered by T-Mobile these days, this one doesnโt include taxes and fees. Thatโs become important for T-Mobile, as separate charges mean it is much easier to increase customer spending without officially raising prices by simply increasing said fees. Weโve already seen the company increase its telco fees as recently as last April, but it looks like the company is doing it again. Donโt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?
